playn.core.ResourceCallback

Deprecated Methods
playn.core.CachingAssets.getPendingRequestCount()
           
playn.core.Assets.getPendingRequestCount()
          Use WatchedAssets. 
playn.core.AbstractAssets.getPendingRequestCount()
           
playn.core.CachingAssets.isDone()
           
playn.core.Assets.isDone()
          Use WatchedAssets. 
playn.core.AbstractAssets.isDone()
           
playn.core.Canvas.setTransform(float, float, float, float, float, float)
          You almost certainly do not want to do this because this will wipe out any pre-configured HiDPI transform and break automatic handling of HiDPI screens. You should instead use Canvas.transform(float, float, float, float, float, float), and possibly Canvas.save() and Canvas.restore() if you need to return to the "identity" (which is in quotes because the identity on a HiDPI screen will not be the the actual identity matrix). This also cannot be implemented on iOS, and so does not work on that platform.
